>
[Stone of Weight](/Equipment.aspx?ID=608)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="Conjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=33" />
<trait label="Cursed" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=274" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Gamemastery Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=22) pg. 92</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 hand

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Also known as a loadstone, this small stone appears nonmagical and has a lovely sheen, giving the impression that it could be a valuable or a notable item or a magic stone of some kind. When you’ve carried the stone on your person for 1 minute, its curse activates: the stone’s size does not change, but it suddenly increases in weight to 5 Bulk. This additional weight does not cause the stone to deal more damage if thrown or used as a weapon. It reappears in your possessions within 1 minute if you discard it, and can’t be destroyed or thrown away permanently, or even placed in a container that would reduce or negate its Bulk (like a [_bag of holding_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=249)), until it is subject to a [_remove curse_](/Spells.aspx?ID=250) spell or similar magic effect. Once the curse has activated for the first time, the stone fuses to you.
